title: Barnett Cohen
text:
Barnett Cohen (1891–1952) was a Russian-born American <a href="bacteriologist">bacteriologist</a> who performed the first ultra-microscopic surgeries, including on <a href="amoeba">amoeba</a>.
Cohen received his Ph.D. from <a href="Yale%20University">Yale University</a>. He was president of the <a href="Society%20of%20American%20Bacteriologists">Society of American Bacteriologists</a>, and a member of the <a href="American%20Association%20for%20the%20Advancement%20of%20Science">American Association for the Advancement of Science</a>,
the <a href="American%20Chemical%20Society">American Chemical Society</a>, and <a href="American%20Public%20Health%20Association">American Public Health Association</a>.
